intro: Isgarum didymum, commonly known as the twin-leafed herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, compound leaves that are often divided into two pairs of leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to temperate regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
